entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 9:56PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: As temperatures rise into the 80s through mid-week, the Taiya and other area rivers and streams are forecast to rise to bankfull conditions from rapid snowmelt in higher elevations through at least Wednesday. Hikers on the lower portion of the Chilkoot Trail should note that portions of the Chilkoot Trail could begin to inundate with water.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:27AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOODING FROM LAKE DRAINAGE NEAR NUIQSUT... A lake 23 miles west of Nuiqsut is expected to drain rapidly into Judy Creek and Fish Creek sometime in the next two weeks, impacting camps downstream. Water levels are expect to rise 2 to 6 feet over a 12 to 24 hour period once it releases.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY LATE THIS HOLIDAY WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend across the Inner Channels with highs from the upper 70s into the 80s. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. At

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:20AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog to Hamper Morning Travel... Moist ground and very light or calm winds this morning have allowed for the formation of patchy dense fog especially in valleys, low spots, and near rivers or other bodies of water. Fog seems particularly problematic along the Interstate 77 corridor from east of Wilkesboro northward toward Fancy Gap Virginia.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:20AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR THE HOLIDAY WEEKEND... Warm and very dry conditions expected over the holiday weekend. An upper-level system and dry cold front will bring gusty winds this afternoon and evening and again tomorrow. The winds, in combination with the warm and dry weather, will result in elevated fire weather conditions across much of the region.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Humboldt County; Northern Elko County; Northern Lander County and Northern Eureka County; Northwestern Nye County; Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range; Southern Lander County and Southern Eureka County; Southwest Elko County

entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued July 03 at 4:01AM AST until July 03 at 6:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected due to breaking waves of 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...Beaches across the southern and eastern coasts of Saint Croix. * WHEN...Through this afternoon.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 02 at 3:06PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner and Boundary. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:49AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog Early This Morning... Through 7 AM, areas of dense fog will reduce visibilities to a quarter mile or less in parts of central and southwest Wisconsin. This fog will quickly dissipate between 7 AM and 8 AM. If traveling early this morning, be prepared for dense fog that could suddenly reduce visibilities to 1/4 mile or less. Slow down
entry.cap:areaDesc: Adams; Crawford; Grant; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Vernon

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued July 03 at 2:44AM CDT until July 03 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Marquette, Green Lake, Fond du Lac, Sauk, Columbia, Dodge, Iowa, Dane and Jefferson Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Columbia; Dane; Dodge; Fond Du Lac; Green Lake; Iowa; Jefferson; Marquette; Sauk
